result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Court dismisses and reads into cases 21CF945 and 21CF1501

defendant.name: Ellifson, Christian M

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:29 AM Defendant Christian M Ellifson in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into cases 21CF956 and 21CF1501
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses and reads into cases 21CF945 and 21CF1501
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:19 AM Defendant Christian M Ellifson in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Attorney Jessica Klein appointed sounds by Public Defender's Office

Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendants bail increase from $2000.00 to $10,000.00 2/22/22.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.   CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 buisness day of being released.

09:09 AM Defendant Christian M Ellifson in court, in custody, in person with attorney Jessica A Klein, friend of the court by zoom.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Klein requests a trial date in case 21CF956 and this matter to tag along. 
State does not object.
Atty Klein requests a preliminary hearing in this matter within 10 days.
Court on its own motion increases cash bail to $10,000.00 same conditions.
  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prior: S18 W36869 Gramling St, Dousman, WI 53118

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 buisness day of being released.

03:52 PM Defendant Christian M Ellifson in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if a WCS non compliance letter is filed with the court, the Court will issue an immediate warrant.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
